TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Statement

Docs.summary: Represents the element defined by SAML 2.0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2SecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify whether a subject is authorized to access a specific resource. The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements. The SAML 2.0 specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement> class. When specified in a SAML 2.0 assertion in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Assertion.Statements%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement> asserts an authorization decision regarding access by the subject of the assertion to a specified resource. The subject of the SAML 2.0 assertion is specified by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Assertion.Subject%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. The following table summarizes the properties that are associated with the authorization decision.
|Property|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Decision%2A>|The authorization decision rendered by the SAML authority with respect to the resource represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement.Resource%2A> property.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Evidence%2A>|A set of SAML assertions that the SAML authority relied on to render the decision.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement.Resource%2A>|A URI reference that identifies the resource to which access is sought.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Actions%2A>|The set of actions that the subject is authorized to perform on the resource represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement.Resource%2A> property. Each action is represented by an instance of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Action>.|
[!INCLUDE[wif_saml2_ref](~/includes/wif-saml2-ref-md.md)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri resource, valuetype System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAccessDecision decision) cil managed

Docs.param: The of the resource about which the authorization decision applies. Sets the property.
A value that indicates the decision. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified decision for the specified resource.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Actions%2A> property is initialized to null in the new instance.

Docs.exception: is not an absolute URI or an empty relative URI.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri resource, valuetype System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAccessDecision decision, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Action> actions) cil managed

Docs.param: The of the resource about which the authorization decision applies. Sets the property.
A value that indicates the decision. Sets the property.
A collection of that specifies the actions to be authorized on the resource. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified decision for the specified actions on the specified resource.
Docs.exception: is not an absolute URI or an empty relative URI.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the set of actions authorized to be performed on the specified resource.
Docs.value: A collection of type that specifies the authorized actions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Corresponds to the `<saml:Actions>` child element. [!INCLUDE[wif_saml2_ref](~/includes/wif-saml2-ref-md.md)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the decision rendered by the SAML authority with respect to the specified resource.
Docs.value: One of the values that specify the authorization decision rendered by the SAML authority with respect to access by the subject to the specified resource.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Corresponds to the `<saml:Decision>` child element. [!INCLUDE[wif_saml2_ref](~/includes/wif-saml2-ref-md.md)]

Docs.exception: An attempt to set a value that is not a valid value occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Uri EmptyResource

Docs.summary: Gets an empty URI reference. The reference may be used to set the property. When used, it specifies the start of the current document.
Gets or sets the set of assertions that the SAML authority relied on in making the decision. [Saml2Core, 2.7.4]

remarks.format: ## Remarks Corresponds to the `<saml:Evidence>` child element. [!INCLUDE[wif_saml2_ref](~/includes/wif-saml2-ref-md.md)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URI reference that identifies the resource to which access authorization is sought.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Corresponds to the `Resource` attribute [!INCLUDE[wif_saml2_ref](~/includes/wif-saml2-ref-md.md)].
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Resource%2A> property may be set to an absolute URI or to the empty URI reference (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.EmptyResource>). When it is set to the empty URI reference, the meaning is defined to be the start of the current document.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set a value that is occurs.
An attempt to set a value that is not an absolute URI or is not an empty relative URI occurs.
